description: Enjoy a series of peaceful walking trails in this forest and nature reserve in Wragby. The tranquil medieval woodland contains ancient limes and is well known for its large numbers of butterflies. There are three colour coded walking trails to try. Two are very easy walks on well surfaced paths which will suit all abilites. There is also a longer route which can be a bit muddy. It's a very tranquil place with a diversity of flora of fauna to look out for. Birdwatchers can look out for nuthatch, Woodlark, Buzzard, Hen harrier and green and great spotted woodpecker. There have also been 16 species of butterfly recorded. The reserve is located about 10 miles east of Lincoln, and not far from Horncastle .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Head north into neabry Wragby and you could visit the historic Ivy pub. The pub dates to the 17th century and includes a charming old interior with tables filling the alcoves and edges of the wooden beamed and paneled bar. You can find them on the Market place at postcode LN8 5QU.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woods are ideal for dog walking. You will probably meet other owners on your visit. The Ivy mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: In Lincoln there's the interesting Spires and Steeples walk which runs through the countryside to Sleaford, visiting several pretty villages with historic churches along the way.

display_address: Hoop Lane, Hoop Lane Farm, Langton by Wragby, East Lindsey, Lincolnshire, England, LN8 5QB, United Kingdom
